articles.description:

articles.author: Roy Ward
articles.title: Smith turns from tutor to skipper as Storm head to Albury - Sydney Morning Herald
articles.description: Cameron Smith grew a beard and embraced being a home-school teacher during the NRL's hiatus but is back to his job as a footballer with the Storm to begin training in Albury this week.
articles.content:
While in Albury the players will be confined to their accommodation except when training or eating as the league looks to prevent any chance of infection.
It's likely the players are allowed home to see family on the weekend.

articles.title: NRL 2020: Sacrifices made by New Zealand Warriors show yet again why they are so important to our game - NRL.COM
articles.description: The Warriors are a significant reason for an extra $75 million broadcast deal and the increase in New Zealanders from 26 before their introduction to 114 this year.

articles.title: Hooper: NRL will blow up the 2020 draw and start again. Here’s how it will work - Fox Sports
articles.description: The NRL will begin work on a completely new draw this week as rugby league continues to be at the forefront of Australian sport by pioneering a way out of the COVID-19 pandemic.
articles.content:
The old draw will be blown up for a new-look competition structure from scratch and will involve the usual heavy consultation with broadcasters Fox Sports and Channel 9 and is unlikely to be released until the end of next week at the earliest.

articles.description: Sydney Kings star Casper Ware is the latest high-profile import to opt out of his NBL contract as a result of the league’s salary cuts.

The American point guard was the highest-paid import in the competition last season after Sydney lured him away from Melbourne United.
